column5: ha! Then we'll need a helicopter to air lift the frozen-solid-to-the-lake snow blower.
Got a yammy venture 500 2up fan. The gf doesnt like the walk, but loves icefishin! Have to hook up this winter man!!!  S.
That's a wicked sled
Yup I'm ready !!!!

Great sled, solid Phazer engine, good for ice fishing and fun for the trails too, I'm a Yammi guy too.  Anytime! I will likely do a G2G thing again in early March, see if we can get more than just Kewley and I out, haha  Shawn, do you get a new sled every 6 months? Hahaha What's the story?

No Chris not every 6 months every 12 months !!! Lol ... I have had 3 new sleds last 3 years just trade them in on a new one every year on a spring order sled !!! Gonna keep this one for a few years when I get it in a few weeks .... When you get a spring order only sled you have to order them almost a year ahead as they are special order only and carry a lot better resale and of course a higher price .... Fishing & sledding 2 very expensive life choices ..... Lol ... Yup
Once the daytime highs are less than seven degrees Celsius it's time to get them on.
Beeeyootiful Viper!
I woke up to scattered snowflakes falling here! It's suppose to be back into the 60's again tomorrow though.

My girlfriends daughter came running down on Saturday to tell me it snowed the night before.  SO my son jumps out of bed yelling "MoMobile, Momobile!!!"  Doesn't even put his coat in..  Just his rubber boots.  Finds the hidden key to the garage, and beats me outside..  This is where I found him...  Begging for a ride.    But there was no snow.  Just a few patches on the deck..  It took some explaining to him why we couldn't go for a ride.  Love this kid!

NAW great picture of your son, priceless  I was ready for winter as some of u may know lol until our furnace went out last night a 6,,cant get it looked at till this evening bbbbrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr  getting a bit fresh inside yikes
Barrie is under a snow squal watch!!  http://www.theweathernetwork.com/alerts/high-alert/canada/ontario/barrie  Oh I can't wait!!  Still got the summer tires on the car, gunna be a gong show!!
Winter.. PFFTT... just hoping it sets the toothy critters into a feeding mode for Monday / Tuesday on the Bay!
It should be good for getting the Ring Neck ducks to push south..  I've only shot 2 this year...  When the flocks come in, we normally double limit on them all the time.

Good thread! I have a question regarding snow tires....  When to put them on!?!  Too early and your tread life is reduced.... Too late and your driving on marbles....  Anyone have a time or method they use when to put em on?  I live in the Quinte region, I was thinking Nov. 1st....  I'm sure there are some theories out there when to swap....  I'm all ears.  G
Around here, the weekend either side of Remembrance Day.  There's the odd storm that comes but melts on the roads. The next 2 weeks still look reasonably snow free.
Nick, it,s snow, it,s Barrie, it,s fishing time. Aint going to keep me away from drifting
I'm going to get the Bravo out for a rip tonight!!!
Pffft is right.
Brian, (either of you) want to go ice fishing Kemp on Monday?

Anyone have a time or method they use when to put em on?  My winter tires are always in the garage and ready to go, I just watch the weather forecasts and when they call for the 1st snow, then on they go and it's normally in December sometime.

Good thread! I have a question regarding snow tires....  When to put them on!?!  Too early and your tread life is reduced.... Too late and your driving on marbles....  Anyone have a time or method they use when to put em on?  I live in the Quinte region, I was thinking Nov. 1st....  I'm sure there are some theories out there when to swap....  I'm all ears.  G  Do like 90% of my customers do   try and get them on RIGHT AFTER the first weather watch is announced; just like today!!!!!!!!!!! My phone here hasn't stopped ringing; Dan I need my snows on, can I come in now. Sorry you'll need to take a number, we're working on #30 now and the last person to book is #80; I'll call you. So if the shop that you deal with has time, get them on anytime after Thanksgiving and avoid the rush. The amount of tire you're going to wear off would be un-measurable. It's a crap shoot; put them on to early and you wear a little bit of tire; to later you're kicking yourself; so throw the dice?  Dan.  P.S.  Give the shop you deal with some slack when it comes to putting the snows on; we're working our ass off trying to accommodate.
Brian, (either of you) want to go ice fishing Kemp on Monday?   If only it was true Jer.
Snowing here now.
Been ready since June ? BRING MORE OF IT ON Nothin better than driving out on a lake u can't to by boat drillin thru 50 inches of ice and bringing home dinner?

I'm crazy excited about ice fishing.   Can't wait for first ice.  Gunna be a long 2 months.  But I just got my boat back from storage.  So maybe I'll scratch the itch with some Simcoe perch.   As far as timing on snow tires.. I have a set in my garage in steel rims that I out on when the snow starts to fly.  I may put them on tomorrow morning.
Looking forward to some ice fishing, and trying some new activities this winter.
I'm praying for snow. Just bought a sled this week. Bring it. LOTS of it!  S.
U last 3 guys are cool lol
My at's got a snowflake on em.   I'm ready.
Winter is my favorite time of year! Right next to spring fall and summer?  Easy access to the lake is just a bonus, and who doesnt enjoy a nice sled ride?
What did you pick up Shane?  I'll still get lots of hours in a boat I'm sure. Then, first ice = biggies bite!
Never mind the snow, bring on the ice!!! chomp, chomp, chomp!!!

Livinfishin: 'new activities", what else you got planned this winter?  I have my best supply of firewood yet, so I consider myself 'ready'.  The track on my tundra needs replacement, so 'not ready'  I bought a riding mower with a snow blower attachment, but I don't know if it'll work well, so 'not ready'  I hear it'll be a milder winter that last year, so 'ready!!'
Chad, think that snow blower will help get us out of Calendar Bay this year? My boots are still soaked.
